document.docAuthor: Giroti, André Marsola & Brescovit, Antonio Domingos
document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Dysdera maxima Nicolet, 1849 : 341
, pl. 2, figs 6A‒D (♀ holotype from Santiago [33°26'16"S; 70°39'01"W], Chile, 1845, C. Gay leg., deposited in MNHNP-AR 9068 (4210), examined).— Keyserling (1877: 230) .

Dysdera virens Nicolet, 1849 : 342
(5♀ syntypes from Santiago, Chile [33°26'16"S; 70°39'01"W], 1845, C. Gay leg., deposited in MNHNP-AR 9071 (4143), examined).— Keyserling (1877: 230) .— Simon (1896: 64, Syn.) .— Petrunkevitch (1911: 131) .

Dysdera incerta Nicolet, 1849 : 342
(2♀ syntypes from Santiago, Chile [33°26'16"S; 70°39'01"W], 1845, C. Gay leg., deposited in MNHNP-AR 9072 (4132), examined).— Keyserling (1877: 230) .— Simon (1896: 64, Syn.) .— Petrunkevitch (1911: 131) .

Dysdera coarctata Nicolet, 1849 : 344
, pl. 2, figs 7A‒C (4 immature syntypes from Santiago, Chile [33°26'16"S; 70°39'01"W], 1845, C. Gay leg., deposited in MNHNP-AR 9070 (4145)), examined).— Simon (1864: 106) .— Keyserling (1877: 230) .— Petrunkevitch (1911: 131) .— Bonnet (1956 : 1619).— Beatty (1970: 469, Syn.) .

Dysdera longipes Nicolet, 1849 : 343
, pl. 2, fig. 8 (1♂ 2♀ syntypes from ValdiVia, Chile [39°49'51"S; 73°13'15"W], 1845, C. Gay leg., deposited in MNHNP-AR 9067 (4133), examined). — Simon (1896: 64, Syn.) .— Petrunkevitch (1911: 131) .

Segestria pusilla Nicolet, 1849 : 345
, pl. 2, fig. 9 (Immature holotype from Chile, should be deposited in MNHNP, lost).— Brignoli (1976: 50) .—
NEW SYNONYMY
.

Ariadna pusilla—
Giroti & Brescovit (2011: 63, Transf. from
Segestria
, as nomem dubium )
.

Ariadna maxima—
Simon (1896 : 64, Transf. from
Dysdera
; 1902: 11; 1905: 71).—O. P.- Cambridge (1898: 17) .— Petrunkevitch (1911: 131) .— Bonnet (1955: 734) .— Beatty (1970: 469, figs 2, 18‒19, 21) .— Grismado (2008: 349, figs 2, 5F‒H, 8H‒I, 9A‒D) .— Giroti & Brescovit (2015: 3, figs 9A, 10A) .— World Spider Catalog (2018) .

Ariadna ashantica Strand, 1916 : 54
( 1♂ 2♀ syntypes from Ashanti [ 06°45'N ; 01°30'W ], Ghana , H. Simon leg, deposited in SMF 2810 , examined.).
—
NEW SYNONYMY
.

Ariadna levii—
Grismado (2008: 345, in part, only the ♀ paratype, misidentification) .

Synonymy. Giroti & Brescovit (2011) transferred
Segestria pusilla
to
Ariadna
as nomen dubium , since the unavailability of the holotype and the indefiniton of the type-locality. Considering characters from Nicolet's description, as the carapace reddish brown and light yellow legs, together with the distribution of
Ariadna maxima
in Chile , this species is here proposed as a junior synonym of
A. maxima
. Grismado (2008) described a female paratype of
Ariadna levii
, depicting the female internal genitalia of a non-type specimen. After the examination of those specimens, we detected that the paratype actually is
Ariadna maxima
, due to coloration, macrosetae pattern and leg size in relation with body size. The diffuse abdominal pattern presented by the paratype is usual to
A. maxima
. On the other hand, the described and depicted genitalia in Grismado (2008: 344, figs 6D‒E) belongs to an
A. levii
specimen.The oddest synonym proposal involves the African species
Ariadna ashantica Strand, 1916
. In his work, Strand (1916) described this species based on a male and the cephalothorax and legs of a possible female from Ashanti region , in Ghana . After the examination of the type specimens, we identified them as
A. maxima
, based on the morphology of the male palp and metatarsi I. The occurrence of
A. maxima
in a locality so far away of the type locality is rather odd, but it could have occurred by anthropic introduction or even human-error handling and labeling the vial in the museum.

Additional material examined. CHILE :

Diagnosis.
Ariadna maxima
is similar to
A. araucana
and
A. lalen
n. sp.
due to the morphology of the male metatarsi I and leg macrosetae pattern of females, but differ by the presence of a male metatarsi I sinuous in lateral view ( Fig. 14C‒D ), and palps rounded, with the midportion and embolus with similar size ( Fig. 15A‒B ); females differ by the anterior receptaculum billobulated ( Figs 9B , 15C‒D ), with a large median glandular ducts plate and interpulmonary fold with a dorsal median membranous crack ( Fig. 9B ).

Variation. Male (n=10): Total length 7.7‒11.15; carapace 3.9‒5.6 long, 2.7‒3.8 wide; femur I 3.7‒5.88. Female (n=10): Total length 10.43‒20.25; carapace 5.25‒7.75 long, 3.31‒5.0 wide; femur I 4.18‒5.56.
Distribution. Central and south of Chile , Argentina ( Neuquén Province ), and Ghana ( Ashanti region ) ( Fig. 70 ).
